item.title: Jesus Heals the Paralytic - Deeper
item.description: We all the know the stories of Jesus' healings. The blind, the lame, the sick, the bleeding, the demon possessed, the lonely, the depressed, even the dead. Is there a deeper truth here, something greater than medical miracles. Join us as wee look deeper.

item.title: Biblical Friendship - Audio Steeple
item.description: We are created by a communal God to exist in a community. Our very nature desires close friends and our faith calls us to build these friendships in a biblical way. So what is a biblical friendship and what would it look like to exist in one? Cory breaks down what we see in the Bible and how it relates to us today. You can follow this podcast wherever you listen to podcasts and on Instagram @AudioSteeple so you do not miss any devotionals or discussions.

item.title: Spiritual Gifts - Audio Steeple
item.description: What are spiritual gifts? What role do they play in the church? What role do they play outside the church? The human body is most effective when all parts are functioning well. item.title: Sexual Integrity with Matt Wilkinson - Audio Steeple
item.description: It is not a secret that sexual sin is thriving in todays world. 35% of all downloads from the internet are pornographic and over $3,000 is spent on pornography every second. Unfortunately, this sin can be hidden and kept secret. We can easily sweep it under the rug. But we cannot hide from God. Sexual sin is spoken about time and time again in the Bible and we are called to purify ourselves. But how? Matt Wilkinson joins us for this episode to discuss sexual integrity and why it is so important. You can follow this podcast wherever you listen to podcasts and on Instagram @AudioSteeple so you do not miss any devotionals or discussions.

item.title: A Faithful Life - Audio Steeple
item.description: There are examples of people who have astonishing faith all through the Bible. One such example is that of Daniel. Daniel has a life-altering (possibly life-ending) decision to make when he finds himself in a foreign land under a foreign rule that worships foreign gods. David Clouse will lead us through a look at the life of Daniel. How he is able to use his life in a pagan empire, how he chooses God, and how we can follow his lead. You can follow this podcast wherever you listen to podcasts and on Instagram @AudioSteeple so you do not miss any devotionals or discussions.

item.description: We have the privilege for this episode to catch up with Christy who is working in Vancouver as a Refugee Resettlement Worker. Christy is passionate about Gods call on her life and passionate about showing Gods love to those who need it most, which is exactly what the Bible tells us we are to do! We hope Christys story gives you hope and passion for Gods word and Gods work. You can follow this podcast wherever you listen to podcasts and on Instagram @AudioSteeple so you do not miss any devotionals or discussions.

item.title: A Healthy Prayer Life with Buck Romero - Audio Steeple
item.description: Is prayer really that important? Is it really that powerful? If so, how are we supposed to go about it? Prayer is often said to be life-altering, uplifting, and a direct line of communication with the Creator of all things. But have you ever felt very disconnected in your prayers? You are not alone. We were able to sit down and talk about prayer life with Bedrock pastor Buck Romero in order to gain some great insight on what it means to have a healthy prayer life. You can follow this podcast wherever you listen to podcasts and on Instagram @AudioSteeple so you do not miss any devotionals or discussions.

item.title: A Look At Doubt - Audio Steeple
item.description: Doubt is a very human thing. In a fallen world it is impossible not to experience doubt and some point in your life. Christ-followers can feel as if they are somewhat less than those around them when they feel doubt creeping in. This can lead to feelings of shame and trying to hide issues. You are not alone in your doubt. Andrew Pivetz will take you through biblical examples of doubt and explain how it is not the doubt itself, but what we do with it that makes all the difference. You can follow this podcast wherever you listen to podcasts and on Instagram @AudioSteeple so you do not miss any devotionals or discussions.

item.title: Trauma Focused Discipleship - Audio Steeple
item.description: Life is not perfect. It is can be messy and hurtful at times. We can fall into the trap of pretending everything is always okay and think that we are living a good Christian life. This is the opposite of what we see in the Bible. Jesus reaches people in their hurting and in their pain. What if we focused on helping people in their hurting as well? Join Tim Sosin (member of Bedrock Fishtown and founder of Birthstone Trauma Healing) as he discusses Trauma-Focused Discipleship. You can follow this podcast wherever you listen to podcasts and on Instagram @AudioSteeple so you do not miss any devotionals or discussions.

item.title: How To Continue A Legacy with Lee Steele - Audio Steeple
item.description: What is a Legacy? We might not realize it, but the term Legacy does not always carry positive ideas and actions. What legacy will we as individuals leave behind? What legacy will the Church leave behind? As Christians, we have been tasked to carry the legacy of Christ through our lives. David sits down with Pastor Lee Steele to discuss what it means to continue a legacy at an individual level and as a Church. Are we doing it well? You can follow this podcast wherever you listen to podcasts and on Instagram @AudioSteeple so you do not miss any devotionals or discussions.

item.title: The Lost Art of Lamenting - Audio Steeple
item.description: Lamenting is something we see throughout the Bible. In fact, there is an entire book dedicated to the Lamentations of a prophet. But, how does this translate to us? Are we supposed to lament? Is there a right way to lament? David Clouse dives into the topic to help us better understand what this can look like in our lives by seeing how it works in the Bible. Be sure to follow Audio Steeple where you listen to podcasts and on Instagram @audiosteeple so you do not miss a devotional or discussion.

item.title: Philippians 2:12-18 - No Matter What
item.description:
Philippians 2:1218
Lights in the World
[12] Therefore, my beloved, as you have always obeyed, so now, not only as in my presence but much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling, [13] for it is God who works in you, both to will and to work for his good pleasure.
[14] Do all things without grumbling or disputing, [15] that you may be blameless and innocent, children of God without blemish in the midst of a crooked and twisted generation, among whom you shine as lights in the world, [16] holding fast to the word of life, so that in the day of Christ I may be proud that I did not run in vain or labor in vain. [17] Even if I am to be poured out as a drink offering upon the sacrificial offering of your faith, I am glad and rejoice with you all. [18] Likewise you also should be glad and rejoice with me. (ESV)

item.title: Philippians 2:1-8 - No Matter What
item.description:
Philippians 2:18
Christs Example of Humility
[1] So if there is any encouragement in Christ, any comfort from love, any participation in the Spirit, any affection and sympathy, [2] complete my joy by being of the same mind, having the same love, being in full accord and of one mind. [3] Do nothing from selfish ambition or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves. [4] Let each of you look not only to his own interests, but also to the interests of others. [5] Have this mind among yourselves, which is yours in Christ Jesus, [6] who, though he was in the form of God, did not count equality with God a thing to be grasped, [7] but emptied himself, by taking the form of a servant, being born in the likeness of men. [8] And being found in human form, he humbled himself by becoming obedient to the point of death, even death on a cross. (ESV)
1. We Are Saved By Humility 2. We Are Saved For Humility

item.title: Philippians 1:27-30 - No Matter What
item.description:
Philippians 1:27-30
27 Only let your manner of life be worthy[a] of the gospel of Christ, so that whether I come and see you or am absent, I may hear of you that you are standing firm in one spirit, with one mind striving side by side for the faith of the gospel, 28 and not frightened in anything by your opponents. This is a clear sign to them of their destruction, but of your salvation, and that from God. 29 For it has been granted to you that for the sake of Christ you should not only believe in him but also suffer for his sake, 30 engaged in the same conflict that you saw I had and now hear that I still have.
Lives Worthy of the Gospel 1. Stand Together 2. Strive Together 3. Are Courageous Together

item.title: Philippians 1:18-26 - No Matter What
item.description:
To Live Is Christ Yes, and I will rejoice, 19 for I know that through your prayers and the help of the Spirit of Jesus Christ this will turn out for my deliverance, 20 as it is my eager expectation and hope that I will not be at all ashamed, but that with full courage now as always Christ will be honored in my body, whether by life or by death. 21 For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain. 22 If I am to live in the flesh, that means fruitful labor for me. Yet which I shall choose I cannot tell. 23 I am hard pressed between the two. My desire is to depart and be with Christ, for that is far better. 24 But to remain in the flesh is more necessary on your account. 25 Convinced of this, I know that I will remain and continue with you all, for your progress and joy in the faith, 26 so that in me you may have ample cause to glory in Christ Jesus, because of my coming to you again.
1. Jesus is Our Life 2. Jesus is Our Eternal Life

item.title: Philippians 1:1-8 - No Matter What
item.description:
No Matter What Pursue Jesus
We Share in the Gospel of Jesus We Share in the Joy of Grace We Share in Trials of Life
Philippians 1:18
Greeting
[1] Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus,
To all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the overseers and deacons:
[2] Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Thanksgiving and Prayer
[3] I thank my God in all my remembrance of you, [4] always in every prayer of mine for you all making my prayer with joy, [5] because of your partnership in the gospel from the first day until now. [6] And I am sure of this, that he who began a good work in you will bring it to completion at the day of Jesus Christ. [7] It is right for me to feel this way about you all, because I hold you in my heart, for you are all partakers with me of grace, both in my imprisonment and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel. [8] For God is my witness, how I yearn for you all with the affection of Christ Jesus. (ESV)

[6] And I am sure of this, that he who began a good work in you will bring it to completion at the day of Jesus Christ. [7] It is right for me to feel this way about you all, because I hold you in my heart, for you are all partakers with me of grace, both in my imprisonment and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel. [8] For God is my witness, how I yearn for you all with the affection of Christ Jesus. (ESV)
